alert.note: Alert for McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:15PM CDT until April 01 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR LAKE...WILL...EASTERN MCHENRY...DUPAGE AND COOK COUNTIES... At 815 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Richmond to Roselle to near Elwood to near Dwight, moving east at 60 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS. TAKE SHELTER NOW! HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. These severe storms will be near... Schaumburg, Elmhurst, Lombard, Addison, Glendale Heights, Elk Grove Village, New Lenox, Fox Lake, Roselle and Bloomingdale around 820 PM CDT. Arlington Heights, Des Plaines, Mount Prospect, Ohare Airport, Round Lake Beach, Melrose Park, Maywood, Franklin Park, Norridge and Antioch around 825 PM CDT. Skokie, Orland Park, Oak Park, Glenview, Park Ridge, Niles, Austin, Mokena, Frankfort and Portage Park around 830 PM CDT. Chicago, Evanston, Tinley Park, West Ridge, Irving Park, Lake View, Lincoln Park, Wilmette, Matteson and Rogers Park around 835 PM CDT. Chicago Heights, Zion, Park Forest, Homewood, Steger, Country Club Hills, Hazel Crest, Flossmoor, Glenwood and Crete around 840 PM CDT. Calumet City, Lansing, Munster, Dolton, South Holland, Sauk Village, Lynwood and Ford Heights around 845 PM CDT. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois...and northwestern Indiana. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION with tornado like wind speeds expected. Mobile homes and high profile vehicles are especially susceptible to winds of this magnitude and may be overturned. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms have the potential to cause serious injury and significant property damage. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
